oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ANIMAL MANURE – REDUCED QUALITY BY ANAEROBIC DIGESTION?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Løes, Anne-Kristin
Johansen , Anders
Pommeresche, Reidun
Riley, Hugh
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we present results from three growing seasons, 2011-2013 to discuss whether anaerobic digestion of animal manure impacts soil characteristics and plant yields.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Løes, Anne-Kristin; Johansen , Anders; Pommeresche, Reidun and Riley, Hugh (2014) ANIMAL MANURE – REDUCED QUALITY BY ANAEROBIC DIGESTION? In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 3, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 891-894.
